body:
Comment 12: 
given that there isn't many gcc compiled programs in the binary distribution, could we
static link them?

yes, it will make our distribution bigger, but we don't need to deal with glibc version
problems any more (we even don't need to always build on machine with an older
version of glibc) This will also help solving issue #6448.

people who care about binary sizes probably don't need prebuilt binaries.

What do you think?

I can write the CL if the idea is acceptable.
